medical_history.chief_complaint: Reduced visual acuity in the right eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with von Hippel-Lindau (VHL) syndrome at age 13 after total loss of vision in the left eye. A right optic nerve head hemangioblastoma was first detected 8 years prior to the current presentation and had been gradually increasing in size, leading to a reduction in visual acuity.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical history includes surgical resection of multiple central nervous system hemangioblastomas at ages 21, 36, 38, 40, and 43, and left nephrectomy for renal cell carcinoma at age 36.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of VHL syndrome includes central nervous system hemangioblastomas and renal cell carcinomas, with premature deaths in the patient's mother, maternal uncle, and maternal grandmother. Two maternal cousins have VHL syndrome.
